Two years on I'm still pissed. As Chris says, S8 was well done in every aspect except the writing. It has become extremely clear that the failure of S8 was solely due to Dave and Dan. They were tired of GOT and eager to move on, and because of that they screwed everyone. Not just the fans but the crew and actors, those 100s of people who took pride in making such a unique show that was the pinnacle of television. The looks and words of the actors in interviews or at the table reads.  HBOs repeated requests to extend the show or at least the season. Even GRRM's writing schedule for WoW was likely affected by this as fans are now eager to see him do it differently, better--and since D&D did get the overall story arc from him, he may be afraid he can't do it any better (I'm thinking of Bran here, but this may apply to all the main characters). 

 D&D lost their oomph, their passion and simply wanted it over, but weren't willing to leave what had been their baby in the hands of others.  So they chose to screw over those who gave a damn.

The writers forgot how to tell a story. Did they have financial worries, or something? Were they just tired? Getting tired and messing up your work of art is what an uncommitted artist will let himself\herself get away with. To be completely satisfying, a piece of music has to return to its tonic note; if it doesn't, you let your audience (and the work of art) down.

A great ending would have been to have Daenerys go mad (if she had to), had John Snow kill her to save the people of King's Landing and the world, and then sit on the Iron Throne as king. THAT would have been a tragic, but satisfying ending!!!

Like it or not, Bran was the only character who had "no skin in the game [of thrones]". Yes, he had been mamed by Jamie, but as he kept saying truthfully, he was no longer that person. Bran was -- like it or not - the only character who would have no old grudges to settle or any old enemies seeking to settle any. As he had become something else, there was not even a grudge against Jamie when the two of them finally met again. As for Dany, she was always FATED to become "the mad queen". Jamie, after all, was justified in breaking his sworn oath to protect the very kind he killed because the king was mad, wishing to "burn them all" for no reason other than that madness. Never once did Dany even flinch when she first ordered her dragons to burn her perceived enemies. If her madness had demanded more to "earn" her actions, then Jon Snow would not have been justified in killing her. He was not her murderer so much as he was the liberator of the people, just as Jamie had been. The "game of thrones" was over the moment that Cersei determined that all of the people of Kings Landing could die for all she cared. She was the ultimate narcissist. Tyrion pleaded with her. Then he pleaded with Dany. And yet Cersie was unmovable and Dany was unstoppable. This was WHO they are. It should have been no surprise that death and destruction would be the only outcome. Unfortunately, however, we are conditioned to accept only Happy Hollywood Endings. Those expecting one here haven't been paying to the rest of Martin's story.
